bug.author: TOsmanov
bug.description:
On page for creating a new task, headers have tooltips that duplicate text of headers. This complicates search for useful tooltips. <denchmark-link:https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/54434686/70430881-ccaf3700-1a8c-11ea-9b1e-c3177e8dfad7.png></denchmark-link>
The following headers have these tooltips:
Name Image quality Overlap size Segment size Start frame Stop frame Frame step Dataset repository URL Issue tracker

comments.comment:
<denchmark-link:https://github.com/TOsmanov>@TOsmanov</denchmark-link> ,
This complicates search for useful tooltips.
What do you mean?

<denchmark-link:https://github.com/nmanovic>@nmanovic</denchmark-link>
I mean, it would be more convenient to have only useful hints, such as: <denchmark-link:https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/54434686/70434060-472f8500-1a94-11ea-8449-d2f6a6ce3830.PNG></denchmark-link>
And tooltips with duplicate heading text do not carry useful information. Because of this, in order to get the right advice, you may have to take a look at unnecessary advice.

<denchmark-link:https://github.com/TOsmanov>@TOsmanov</denchmark-link>
I do not specify these tooltips (like name, image quality, overlap size, etc.). They are added automatically by a framework which I use. There are also meaningful descriptions for image quality, overlap size, segment size. To get them you need to hover mouse cursor on an input field, not on a label of the input field. <denchmark-link:https://github.com/nmanovic>@nmanovic</denchmark-link> Any questions about it?
